intro: Lightfootia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar lightfoot, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a reddish or purplish hue when mature. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona.
